title: Swansea City coach Cameron Toshack,attracting interest from clubs in Portugal and the Championship
text:
Swansea City's highly-rated coach Cameron Toshack is attracting interest from clubs in Portugal and the Championship.

The 49-year-old has forged a strong reputation for his work with Swansea's younger players and has been key in the development of several of the current first team squad plus the likes of Sheffield United striker Ollie McBurnie and Manchester United's Daniel James.

Toshack's standing within the club saw him seriously considered for the first team coach role prior to Swansea appointing former England U17 manager Steve Cooper.

Swansea coach Cameron Toshack is attracting interest from Portugal and the Championship

He had been discussed by Huddersfield Town following the sacking of Jan Siewert and has also been considered by Championship strugglers Barnsley.

However, clubs in Portugal, who have also been impressed with Toshack's work with Swansea's U23s and their style of play, are now weighing up approaches.
description: Swansea City's highly-rated coach Cameron Toshack is attracting interest from clubs in Portugal and the Championship. The coach has been hailed for developing young players.
